upright.description:
This isn't naivete, it's trust in the world around you to work things out as you jump.
It's first-timer's luck, things working out because you keep taking these leaps of faith. Sometimes the fool is falling but getting back up to go again. This is bravery not yet tempered by tragedy, scars, or trauma. It's not a failing, it's innocence with scrapes and bruises as trophies.

Ganesh is the remover of obstacles and patron of academics and intellectuals.  This is a magician of pure competence and good will - bearer of your completion, certainty you will overcome your challenges, and a blessing on new undertakings so you may meet them with utmost confidence.

Divine Knowledge given flesh. She reads the universe and speaks our language all the same. She is an oracle and she will respond, but it will not be an answer you understand. You need a larger understanding to come to grips with it. This will take time, but as you begin to understand the larger world behind this, the answer will unfold for you.
Strange knowledge but you will eventually get it.

Sometimes we become a caretaker for others out of necessity, or because we think we should. Often when we do this, we chain ourselves to that thing we care for. This is a deep need for us to feel like we can accomplish something, and making our ward need us.
It's often necessary but be wary not to create a cycle.

The Emperor is always sure about how things should logically work in their proper places.  He thinks he's found the proper place for all things.
At best he is even handed and smart, knowing who or what one should be is useful.  At worst he is so self-certain that his way is the right one that he forgets to consider others beyond himself.

The despot, manifest destiny, colonialism, empire, religious control.  Someone spouting their words as fact and absolute divine truth.
This is the whispering snake leading you astray, someone who says they know best for you.  They may not always be wrong, but they are too self-certain in their knowledge. Recognize the red flag and draw the line, stay humble and remember you aren't always right.

Separation of loved ones - longing, searching for sings of love. Your love is powerful, love is compromise, handholding, missing one another but being alive without them. A pure, desire-filled hole we make of ourselves.
True love isn't unconditional, that's infatuation.
The card can herald love approaching, or speak of literally another person.

Something is completed, a journey, a struggle, a battle. This is not a time to gloat, but it is a time to feel like you won. You know what it cost to get here. Don't let that be sullied by showboating. You accomplished something and reminding ourselves that the hardest labors we engage in are often uncelebrated or unknown is the victory of the Chariot.

This is the strength to act and make the change you want to see, not just surviving adversity but to challenge it, and fix wrongs you find. This is not oppressive or dominion, it's the strength to get up and act on a plan, following through on it.

The hermit is alone by physical and social distance to find enlightenment. This can sometimes mean a temporary retreat to be alone or to reflect, or it can mean being apart from the world. If you have felt lonely lately this may be a reminder to reflect on what you learned from it. Isolation need not be painful.

Fate, Chaos, and Chance are all the same lady and she's making it up as she goes. It's not the secrets of the universe, it's coincidence. Chaos is waiting to embrace you fully, so give up control, spin the wheel, and follow to see where it goes.

Seeing Injustices and trying to right them, it's equity.  Justice is not of people, it's for them.
Something is tipped wrong on the scales, something needs attention, payment, restitution, reparations.  Balance may need to be made, or someone may know they aren't getting what they gave.  This may not be a call to action, sometimes it's recognition.

In waiting for outcomes to become more clear, we often end up finding strange new truths and paths. Being patient is not being stuck, it's taking time to let the world shift and move the paths that were before you. Opportunities come and go, people's relationships slide in different directions.
When you wait in one spot, new paths unfold.

Where there is an ending there is also a new beginning.
The grim reaper is a symbol of the Death of something that is no longer serving us in our lives, and the curved scythe is an incomplete circle, meaning death is not an end.
Death is responsible for the ashes of the eagle, but it is the Eagle's choice to be reborn from it.

Temperance is not about asserting balance on the world, this is a personal journey.  Being even with yourself and with others, and introspection of your extremes.
Maybe someone annoys you and makes you angry, what is it? Is it a fair anger?
Have an even hand in life.

This is a person, thing, or situation tapping into your primal hungers. Eating when you're already full, etc. This devil feels impossible to ignore. Recognize it's not impossible, we all make choices - but there's another thing to blame in addition to yourself.

Sudden destructive change, loss, or opportunity dropping out from under you. Difficulty that could not be avoided feels unfair because they are taken for a reason you can't change.
This is especially true with issues of modern technology, sudden breaking of something you needed. Lost memories, lost images, lost files and folders.

Looking forward, thinking of the future.  Drawing up plans for the long term, having dreams and a goal.  It's not always useful to daydream and stargaze when you have work in front of you, but it can be helpful to revitalize you and have something to look ahead to.

The Moon is not cruel, it teaches with these illusions, and we can chase that moonlight for help. It tricks us to teach. We are shown with these illusions what is actually happening and who is walking the paths with us, good and bad. The Moon helps us understand what we need to know.

There is warmth, heat, and joy in your life, you need only recognize it and bask in its glow. You don't need to affirm it or support it or prove it, it's already there.
Stop thinking and feel good for once, you're worth it.

Massive realizations, spiritual awakenings - finally seeing how the entire world you thought you knew had other layers you'd never even conceived of before.
Now that you've gone through this awakening, learned what you didn't even know you were lacking, you can't go back. You walk carefully in new lands.

A hungry beast approaches the perfection of the mirror, but it's already shattered - perfection is never what you want.
There is something that will happen when the beast reaches the shattered perfection, a birth of extreme change.
What is your hunger going to give rise to? What happens when your needs are met, and you can support something new?
Acknowledge power present, perhaps in strength in surviving, or an unmoving opponent.  It's self-mastery, not power over others or dominion.  It's strength and power for yourself and by your making.

Revelation comes with enlightenment, not disaster. The fear you held in the night seems insignificant in the day.
Your problems are clear by their long shadows.

The world we live in is made up of our mind's interpretations.  The world feels massive and arbitrary, sometimes even cruel.  Sometimes that's even true. There is a feeling of something bigger than you pressing down, unstoppable.  There is no easy remedy to that.  There is no advice here, no fixes, just recognition of that feeling.

We contain multitudes, you are balancing these multiple selves, energy for your work, knowledge, foundations for work, passion to see it through.
This is balance and draws attention to the need for a balanced approach, or a lack of balance.
Who is the Magician and who needs The Magician's Lessons?

Equal parts mystery and misdirection. The Moon is unknowable dream space. Respect what it shows you, but do not chase after the paths it shows. This is an illusion, if you take it for truth you're lost.
Connect what you've been doing and chasing with your intuition. Find meaning in what you were doing, but don't take it literally.
It can still be a powerful aid in helping you find answers.

That thing you already know but won't or can't admit to yourself. Knowing that something is your fault, or the only way to fix something is to apologize for what you did, or that they aren't right for you.
It's a harsh wisdom but a promise that you already have the tools you need to solve the problem.

A star of abundance, of deep fulfillment.  This is good hope you have, and it will serve you well on the journey.
Your hope kept you safe and sustained on this journey, and you earn more than you wanted, perhaps more than you deserved.  Follow the dream and you'll get more than you knew you could ever need.

Summoning the Sun for joy in our lives.  The Sun is one that says there is joy you can bask in; the Sun Sigil is your sign that you need to make that joy for yourself.  Conjure it with your magic, or by sharing love with someone else.  Make joy.

Sudden, destructive change. There is a kindness after the fear and terror. The fear will eventually end, you do not die here. There is a sense that things will be okay after the dust settles, but you won't see it from the perspective of the actual destruction.

Tradition matters. It can be stifling, but even ancient traditions grow and change over time because humans changed.
Recognize tradition for what it is, our connections to human history.
Sharing in rituals that reach across time is connection, not giving in to conservatism.
It might even help you find out what elements you want to subvert or change.

The World is the greater cycle of us all moving. This is the knowledge that your life and things in it may close and begin anew. It's not necessarily about endings but it is often about beginnings. Watch for new turns of the wheel. There are also connotations of success, fulfillment, achieving your goals.

Swords are the tools of the mind, critical thought, logic.
You hold the tool of the decider, to cut truth from lies. This is a power that requires mental clarity to be held with conviction. You are moving toward the right decision or proper logical choice.

Learning the way of Swords
The first steps of swords are brutal - you are either too patient and let things go ahead of you while you overthink or are too fast to make changes.  Youth you bring to the role lets you speak out against things more readily and begin planning out things before engaging.  This youth can also lead you to share information too freely, or to gossip or be too inquisitive.

A stalwart companion who comes to your aid, but only as directed. You cannot be saved by this knight, but you can use it to save yourself. 
Loyalty, perserverence, belief that you know how best to direct them is their qualities.
This is an ally or event in your life and struggles who you should stop taking for granted, they won't be around forever.

She holds the Sword and knows its hidden uses, cutting down the false.
Queen of Information, transforming the world with knowledge and logic.  She's a sign to find order, or make it.  She knows truth and acts on it, but isn't necessarily kind.  She isn't hateful, but she is cold.  She is harsh truth.

A King set and powerful in the realm of Blades and thought.
There is a fine line between true beauty and the other things that exist, he can slide his blade along that line.
When you're the king of swords, you can't help but cut things. Scathing remarks, pointed jabs, when you see an opening you take it, as long as it proves your blade's edge. Cruelling acting like royalty.
This can be about other people.

The Ace of cups is the bearing of soul and emotion.
Acknowleding that your soul and hope and feeling is born anew, brought forth with new, cool water to quench your thirst.
New ideas and hopes, a new person, new feelings, a cool cup in a long hot stretch of labor.

She starts a path towards personal and emotional enlightment.
The Page is on the start of the path of hope and can sometimes be naive, but remains hopeful because the are paths forward if you look for them.
Bravery pushes her on, courage to keep chasing the belief that we deserve to be happy.

A knight bearing a cup brings emotional contentment, kindness, but more than anything, love and romance.
This is a person or situation bringing you something that will focus on the good, the glory, the kindness, the beauty. it will not be founded in reality, or have clear intentions for action, or anything like logic. Itâ€™s pure feeling. Meet its gift with care.

She who bears the Cup fully.
She is supportive, kind, warm, welcoming, brilliant with intuition, a healer more than a problem solver - she can make you feel better more than she can accomplish solving your problems.
She may be supportive and wise, caring.  She may also drown you in her love and care - sometimes you need fixes, not better feelings.

Someone who is served emotion, who bears and owns it proudly, but who never needs to collect it for themselves.
In a positive light, this is a period of time wherein you are reaping the rewards of your labor. Others help and even serve you because you have 'ruled' so fairly and thoughtfully.
At its worst, the king is impatiently awaiting someone to come fill his damned
cup. he is dependent on others to reciprocate.

The birth of drive, passion, and focus.  The belief in a place for your energies - a new project or opportunity or love, it is gifting you new energies and excitement to chase after it.
Have faith, this is a good new journey.

When we are always looking for things, especially trouble, we tend to find it. If you can't stop critically observing everything, the exposure to your own sights will hurt you. Keep staring at the pain of others and you end up hurting. You must blink, or even close your eyes and sleep. It does no one any good if you see the ills of the world and feel bad. Your guilt or suffering does not alleviate it in others.

Grounded and has goals, a powerful potential and the sincere focus to bring it to life. She hasn't yet made her mark on the world but she will soon.
She focuses on finding core motivations and working from them. You will complete your projects, your goals, your work, because this is raw willpower that rests on foundations, not flippant desire. She is knowledge that you walk in confidence towards your goal.

They who bear the wand to you.  A flighty burst of power, passion, excitement.
If you're ready for it, it can be power you need to overtake your challenges. If you aren't, though, it's frustrating. It's desire to do other things than what you're stuck doing. The need to do a big grand act but not having a platform for it.
A yearning for something bigger than you or where you are.

She knows the depths of the fire in wands and bears them in abundance. She is friendly ambition, leadership potential, knowing where fire comes from and how to stir it in her followers, where it is best used.
At her best she's an organizer, a director, a true leader.  She's independent and doesn't need underlings, but she can direct them.
At her worst she is domineering and controlling.

King, Full of and Seated in Power of Wands
Authority, action at the highest order.  People should follow the example of the king, for good reason.  This king feeds the idea of loyalty, action, organization, and leading the way.

The bearing of a new coin, a new chance, and goals to be achieved. The hand that bares opportunity is a friend. The disks are as much coins as they are foundations to build on, do not view it as only material things.
"Only with the symbolic force of the beast will we reach heaven."

Page 94
Someone in a place of little power who wields their whips on anyone they can find to be their lesser, often driving the pain of hierarchy on to those even below them.
Cruelties done so they feel they have power.
Bullies.

Teach your instincts better manners, gain control over your desires, apply logic to choice. We all have desires, but we can educate our worst selves to make better decisions. This can also apply to you teaching another person, or being taught.
In either case the one doing the teaching views those being taught as being untameable, wild, impossible to deal with.

Being drowned in your work, either by choice or mistaking how far you were going with your intentions and now you can't stop.
We lose ourselves in things all the time, but we must be mindful that we don't disappear into other places for so long that we ignore other people and things.

Your life does not feel your own anymore, you have been made into something others need you to be, and you have taken on the needs of others far before your own, which is foolish.
Push it to change once more, if you can find and confront what changed you then return to yourself once more.

Recognize that all of us do things in our own times, on our own timelines, and experiencing the world differently.
You can't assume other people are on the same page as you, or even in the same time.

It's not shallow to want to be seen or heard, it's normal human behavior.
We are more visible than ever now, and the pain there is the depths to which we can be viewed, but without the in-person, in-depth contact that could help inform a person better.
Now we give more weight to minor slights from strangers than we do those we see every day who know better.
That is a mistake.

The first steps into material stability - friends, items, money, or otherwise.
This is the beginnings of developing a plan, setting up future prospects, spotting the possibility ahead. This is a hopeful card, good news lies ahead because you took the time to look before setting down roots. You will be rewarded for thinking and looking before you leap.

Bringer of Rings/Coins
A sign that there is someone or something to lean on to keep working at something. A support to stay standing, to persist in the face of difficulty and the vastness of time it takes to complete things in life.
This knight is responsible, practical, and ready to hold fast until you are done.

She who bears the Coin best. Money is nothing if not to support community,
to share with those you love. The Queen of Pentacles is the queen of serving others. she knows fullness in coins by converting them to actual worth, good food with friends, mutual aid and support, and love.

Set and bearing within the richness of his coin and kingdom.
Hard work will pay off, and goals can be fulfilled, but once this King holds his coin he does not release it.  He is miserly.
Accomplish what you have set out for, but mind that you do not join him in a throne of greed, or you'll end up self-serving over all else.

An adjustment on the Knight of Swords - keepers of the weapon holding it as a shield. It is the duty of the mighty to protect the weak, and the duty of society to shelter its members. This is the card of stewardship.
No request is too small and no threat is unmet. They carry swords but only draw when needed. Caretakers First. Defenders Second. Assaulters Never.

The bull shows this King has become King by her own work and earning her rest to sit full on her accomplishments and coin.  She could retire, but she is ready to step up if she must.
Not all Kings are users or lucky. This King has made her own foundations for herself and her people.

The bearer of the element of air and swords - of change.
Big change, sudden opportunity, rapid movement. This is a focused burst of opportunity, jump on it or miss it. It's not impulsive, it's thoughtful in approach and offering, but to chase it you'll need to be impulsive.

Learning the way of Cups
Sensitive, kind, gentle, a dreamer or hopeful optimist. Kindness limited to understanding, a desire to dream about things more than -doing- things.  This page is a child new to their emotions, not able to reign them in or be considerate in the face of even minor opposition

Where you look for misery, it can be found. Life can inherently be miserable, but if we fixate and give it so much attention it weighs that much more heavily.
Thinking about good things doesn't make good things happen, but it helps you focus on them. We tend to fixate on the piece that we notice more than anything. Notice when the good things come around.

She rewards you for good and punish you for evils, she is a quick judge and knows how to hold a grudge. She will spread the news as well. This is a person in your life you need to please or fear the wrath of.
She isn't evil or cruel, she's a scale. You get what you put in, she feels difficult to deal with sometimes, but that's not evil or harshness, it's precision clarity.

The Blood Of Survival Is Thicker Than The Water Of The Womb.
We find our own and keep one another safe.
The Queen of Strays is that mother of children vast and different. You should lean on your found family, support others in your community who need you.
No person is unwanted, you deserve to be loved, and so do the people who need you.

A King of Blades who believes in true, objective justice.  He is cold but do not fear him, he brings it on the deserving as well with hopes for better outcomes.  Wrongness and mistakes end, new opportunities open.  His city is strong and propserous because he is fair and gives as much as takes away, but he is the highest authority.

The Nuclear Wife, the caretaker and supporter of those who go out in the world, the lap you curl up in to feel safe, and she destroys anything that gets in the way of that.
She calms you in the face of horrid realities, and although her touch feels flat compared to what she calms you from, sometimes it can be okay to lie to yourself to feel good.

Too often we forget we're allowed to keep playing no matter how old we get.
It can show up when referring to somneone else who is never taking things seriously, but overall we always think people take things too playfully when really maybe we need to be less serious.
Play more games.

A hunter at its core. The Ace of Hounds reminds you that you have teeth to bite with and senses that feed your instinct.
Let go of overthinking and figure it out with your claws, the world has clear meaning when you're hunting.
Be wary, someone may be lording over you in this card, your 'owner' who is letting you think you're this raw beast.

Look into your eyes, in a mirror, for at least 29 seconds every day. This card tells you to burn away that which keeps one from oneself.
Lose everything that has been weighing on you and walk away with only what survives the fire.
This isn't done to you, you do this yourself. Throw your things in the fire and only keep what survives.

The coming dawn, Day, the future.
Be hopeful for the coming dawn and the coming days.

This is change that hurts, mentally, emotionally, physically, maybe all three.
It is rarely you hurting yourself, sometimes the world kicks you when you're down. This is still change, and once you pay your price of blood Death moves on.
If you feel that it lasts forever, recognize your complicity and inability to move on.

A More literal death card, a call to note how change is really just a sort of decay of our bodies.
Anything you see on the surface is how society functions. There's a meat under there that can be exposed under change, carnage, brutality, and the inevitable death.

Things move, change, and die.  This is not a death with change so much as how we live with the change.  Dance on the grave of endings in your life, you lived it.
Learn to celebrate endings and changes in your life. We should celebrate letting things be finite, dance in the face of change.

Most change is a motel on the side of a highway - normal, small, standard, forgetable.
Mundane changes of daily life sometimes find biggest growth.  Remember that every day our lives are always changing, and that's beautiful.  Everything moves, breathes, becomes different in many ways.  Sometimes in our thoughts or memories, we're here for a good time not a long time.

Change comes to all, but this Death leaves nothing behind. Not just letting go to move on, something is burnt away and there is no going back. Approximating it to start anew can be done, but it's probably foolish.
It doesn't have to hurt, but when it happens, you can't return to how things were. Clear the ashes, start over, learn from this, make anew from things that can't burn.

Sometimes change is hard and it hurts, leaving us sobbing alone and feeling like nothing will ever be as it was. We are protective of our lives and the things we lose feel like failures on our part, even if it was time to go.
Let it go, it's okay.
Don't cling to what was lost, see that it's cold in your arms, you just didn't look down.

Sometimes coming to peace with change is realize that change needn't have happened, maybe something wasn't truly done yet.
Take up your shovel and dig that corpse back up. Maybe recognizing an error and making it right, or giving space to something you didn't give proper space to before.
However, this is also coming back to something and deciding not to let go.

We make small changes in strange ways every day.  We know some things can't be taken back but we do them anyways, and we always see it as the lesser of two evils or accruing debt we may never pay for whatever reason, but it's still counting each day.

This could actually mean literal death, I'm sorry.
It also speaks of ending things to let them seed. Our bodies feed the earth, let change become seeds for your future. You might need to end things early but know that the energy you gain back from letting something go will let you thrive in a new something.

This is the desire to stay as things are, the stagnant death of change itself.
Take stock of what you've reanimated or kept from dying. Sometimes we need to recognize that all our labor to keep things from changing is wasted. It'll eventually end, is it worth the life you have left to give your years up to something else?
Sometimes it is, but it's the question this card asks.

Chase after your passion, the inner fire! This is a devil of passion. Often we chase our passions that we end up hurting another by accident. You didn't mean to, but you were thoughtlessly in your own hunger and didn't notice.
Take care chasing your fancies, it's easy to be led astray by your own passions.

Sometimes the difficulties we face come from something done to us or done by us that carries far into our past, the root of many problems. The only way forward may be to go back to that initial pain and acknowledge it, change the space it takes, and reclaim it.
This may not make everything better, but you have to recognize where it began and acknowledge it or it (and you) will never heal.

Comfort in your life, your sex, your body and desires. Complete and utter confidence, but as a devil it can always have the possibility of going too far, becoming unabashed rudeness or cruelty and believing it to be the kind of person you are. This is a person who is so elite their snide and cruel, reclaiming their sexuality but who then treads on another's consent.
This card has swagger, but when we believe in our own grandness we are easily led astray.

Give yourself over to absolute pleasure. Eat that entire jar of nutella with a spoon, go jerk one out, do that dirty, feel-good thing.
Indulge that guilty pleasure. Lean in on it and own it.

Father sleep comes up when there is something you need to recognize as ending. Bed time for the relationship, time to let go of the project.
Understand that things aren't made to last.
It's an important thing to know about when things are coming and when things are going.

Fear recognizes that terror, anxiety, and trauma are real parts of our minds. This is not something you can explain away. You must work around it, but take heart that you're not alone facing it.
Fear is integral to staying alive. Some fear is healthy, so think about how it might be helping you keep going.

Mirrors lie by showing the truth, but the angles are wrong, that's not other people's perception.
This card speaks to hidden meanings and intentions, hidden feelings, keeping up appearances. These mirrors only maintain for so long, and then the secret comes out.
What secret are you keeping, and who are you really keeping it for?

Always paths forward, all options are movement, action. All keys open this door, and it's important to understand sometimes that the most important part of making a choice is to make it.
It might be mistaken or taken in haste, but it was done.
This card tends to come up around indecision, those who would rather make no decision than lock something into place.

Settling snow over the world you once knew. Seeing the grass disappear into a sheet of even whiteness.
Frost is memory, we look back and all the details are gone now, just a plain sheet of what you remember most.
Sometimes this is kind, sometimes your reminiscing removes harshness or helps you move on.
Frost does not fix what it covers. Be wary you aren't blinded to the present.

Giuseppe is a much kinder creature, and it suggests to others we try to be like them.

Draw 3 new cards for that spot in the reading, and if the querent doesn't like them put them back and get another 3.

Even though we are beyond nature in many ways, we are still nature's children and we are still connected to the land.
This card is a reminder of how sacred your interaction with the world is, and the faith that comes from believing we deserve to take part with the world we were given.

Pure, absolute chaos - Raw instinct in an unsafe and unsustainable way, acting on impulse and making decisions that even a second of thought would have overcome. Saving your things from a forest blaze while setting the fire yourself.
They are your own call of the void, to take actions you know better than to take.
You are not beholden to your most base of desires.

Itâ€™s when you are granted divine knowledge from beyond yourself, letting you become a being who can mediate between the divine and us.
You did not learn this on your own, and you must recognize the source of the truth. respect your sources.
This may be learning the truth to overcome a conflict you were faced with, or may be recognizing your role as a leader of sorts - or that people are looking to you as if you were one.

Hope is being in dire situations and believing it isn't the end, like drowning and believing someone is still coming to help.
Having hope can be the most important element of a struggle, it gives you reason to keep going even when there is pain or heartache.
Hope is faith in possibility of good in the world, of better options.
Don't let it go easily.

Rise from the ashes of your past self like a phoenix. Judgement is that moment of rising, awakening, enlightenment from  your past.
Stoking these flames lets us see clearly and understand where we are and who we are, a moment of revelation and sharing with us where we must go next.
It can also be a fear of those same flames and knowledge.  That's perfectly normal.

Wake from your slumber and be seen for the raw person you are, into the new light of an age of change.
This is personal awakening in your own spiritual path or journey. Realizing a divine truth, coming to terms with something you had struggeled with regarding who you truly are, or who you are in terms of the greater universe.
This is ecstatic change

This Justice is raw and action. It's a baseball bat, a union, a knife. It's not in courts or voting; it's community action to right wrongs. It's sometimes painful and taking action, doing what you need to survive and making it clear where you stand.  "Eye for an Eye" is bullshit when the eyes have only been taken on one side for centuries.

This is the natural happenstance of perfect circumstances coming together to explode in brilliance.
You can't make it happen, but you can keep throwing bottles over stormy seas and wait for it to strike.
Nothing good can happen if you don't try to let good things happen in your space.

Ouroboros isn't infinite, it's eating itself. Here it's collision, it's colliding with your own ambition and eating yourself whole. This comes from reaching too far, single-minded, and ignoring all warnings.
It is also a symbol of the rich, taking more and more just because it's there and they can.

Likely, you feel at the control and whims of another.
Sometimes it's hard to accept that other people control massive parts of our destiny, but it's inevitable when you work at a job where someone directly has say in how much you work and how much pay you get, what you deserve and don't.
Recognize what the strings are that they pull, you know what you need to cut to be free.

It creates and creates. This is a sign that you can create more shit if you want. You should keep making stuff, even if it's just for you. Keep going, even if only one person ever sees it and finds warmth and wonder in it, it's worth it.
Even if that one person is you.
Life's too short to worry about just surviving, make things to live as well.

The Allbright brings hope and illumination to knowledge of the past and to those undertaking difficult tasks. She is never far from those who are faithful, or those who have the courage to ask for aid.
Look out for her hope - it's almost always out there, somewhere.

Alleys are where people pass on secret shortcuts, side entrances to most anywhere are in alleys. It's where you go to hide, to sleep, and it's where all the unintended mistakes and side-effects of having a society accumulate.
This is the alley where you meet people you're supposed to, at the time you need to meet them. It comes together just right, and things happen.

The Alleyman is unattached to your story, but they can share wisdom about it and help you walk your path.
Similarly, there are people in your life who aren't part of your life but they are going to share with you what you need to keep going.

This is the glory of the battle itself. The blood, the earnings, the wounds, uncertainty if you'll win but the certainty that you must.
This is the height of rushing into the thick of the fight, seeking affirmation in the blood of those who have chosen to be your enemies.
The Chaos of this battle is where you must go, not to win or lose, but to forge your metal harder and sharper.

Someone must run into the night, so why not you?
You might venture out of curiosity, or to the light the way for others?
The brave rabbit who steps first from safety ensures the survival of its family.

There are many systems in our lives, the Builder doesn't know what it is building, it just keeps building. We are part of these systems, we are sometimes the Builders. We have to recognize that.
The Builder wants us to acknowledge and realize that by living we are part of these systems and choosing to question or not question the system is itself a political choice.

He waits in the dark to horrify, but the Bogeyman is about how we make our own fears up in our mind. It's your own anxiety and figments of nightmare. Your fears are temporary and even if you fail, it won't be that bad.
The Bogeyman isn't real is the most important part. Step through the dark to find the doorway out.

It can be the shoulder to be cried on, or cleaning and feeding and mending the ill.
This speaks to being that warmth and comfort for another, whether it's for you, or another for you.
It can speak to your need for it, or characterize a specific person or event.

That time when we focus on the pain and loss we have faced in our lives and do not let go. We bask in Dark sorrow, lean on it as if it was a good memory at our core.
Sometimes we bask for too long, but you don't have to keep these moments.
This can also point to understanding that you're in a period of grief, mourning, or acceptance of pain. That's not bad, you just need to recognize it.

Emotional freedom, what feels good and how to enjoy things.  The Empress is brilliant at knowing how to live and thrive because she's done it, she's divine and experienced wisdom.  She knows when to say "Yes, more please" and "No more, Thank you."
She has scars from her learning.

The prime material, the canvas. It signifies newness and rawness, in a quiet and dignified manner.
It often relates to children, or blank opportunities that are what you make of them.
It doesn't mean anything is possible, only that you will irrevocably stain and paint this thing as you begin to interact with it.
Be mindful what imprint you leave on its surface.

End the Reading here.  There may be answers ahead, but they are not meant for the querent. Sometimes knowing what is coming will not help you deal with it, or it will be better to experience it as it comes rather than live with the anxiety of its approach.
Continuing reading means you must understand that the querent must keep their path straight and directed.

This is quenching a long dried throat, reviving from someone's thirst. This is relief from pain and having a place to sit a while and bask in what you need.
The Fountain asks if you need this, or perhaps if you can provide this?

An inbetween space between the moon's illusions and the sun's knowledge fulfilled.
It's having already been on the path and finding yourself between states, a liminal state between death and life, or instinct and learned knowledge.

The thing that's missing, the hole is the place where a thing was, not the thing itself.
Figure out what's missing.

Something that has been in your life for a while and possibly even seems safe. When you take for granted what you walk on and use each day, or someone you don't consider separated with their own goals and wants, it will introduce chaos.
This could be a person always overlooked, or something like a data-mining app you always use.

This is a wild card that acts as the bridge between the cards around it.
Don't overthink it, it's exactly that.

Down to your last action, in a desperate situation that needs a desperate response.
You have to breathe, slow down, and make that last shot count.
This is about final chances but also it's about the silver bullet. You have the answer, the fix, chambered up and ready to go.
Your fate is in your hands, you have the tool to win, you just have to steady your hands now and use it.

Communication. Put forth effort tos hare your thoughts, meanings, and intentions.
Talk to each other, just give it a try.
You'll find that honest, open communication of what you mean and what you meant can solve many issues in your life.

Your certainty that if ytou set yourself in stone, your achievements will last forever, but the sand will destroy it as time goes on.
It can speak to ending and defeats, but typically speaks to being fallible and the need to be humbled, if not the humbling loss itself.
If you haven't had the fall yet, step away from the ledge now.

Companionship and becoming whole, as acceptance of the wholeness of each other on their own, knowing that the person with you forms something even greater with you, but does not -need- you to keep living.
This relationship is a union of two or more people in a strong and close bond, and may be sexual, or romantic, or platonic, or quiet, or any mixture of all.

An actor with no master, a wanderer with no set path.
This is a wild card to warn you that it is impossible to know this factor.
Accept that you can't tell who this is or what they'll do, because that's the message you must know.

A sense of something being as wrong as it is right. The person you're speaking to is lying but not maliciously, just by habit. They can't help but treat you like this. You're not a victim, you're an audience member.
Understanding when people have masks to hide versus masks to survive will help you understand why someone would be The Performer.

Treasures to those who seek them out, worthless to those stuck with them and no way to play or use them. It's just a shape that carries meaning.
We care about our memories with our relics more than the item. Figuring out the difference is key to being able to let go of actual junk.

Stories can't tell themselves or the whole truth, but they can tell a truth.
Recognize that stories are not the truth of what happened, but the what was left over after the story occurred. They're important to our lives and cultures but they're secondary to the actual act or living that story.
Recognize the joy a story brings you but remember to keep living, too. Don't get wrapped up in the story.

Something slightly off.  A disconnect between you and how you think of yourself. Dissociation and separation of self from the vessel.
Think of it as a reminder that there is nothing else that can live for you. You must do it for yourself, for who you see in the mirror is, in fact, you - even when it doesn't look like it or you don't like it.

A traitor is an insidiously deeply entwined part of your life or goals, revealing that you nor your goals meant a thing to the Traitor in the end. This isn't always intentional.
Sometimes someone who was part of your life grew in different ways as time went on. Their goals no longer match yours, and they failed to tell you their feelings as things began to fall apart.
Focus on communication with important people in your life.

Unabashed self-certainty, living as yourself in complete power, unafraid. It's raw and humbling to behold, but take care - being unabashedly yourself can lead to disregard other viewpoints, or other people.
Determination, Confidence, Rebellion. These are all in its domain.

Pain, suffering and injury. This is more about the injury you already carry with you, you are learning more about who hurt you and why, but you are not yet beyond the pain.
This can be recognition of your recovery, but it can also be an omen of another injury coming to join your existing wounds.

This card can take you forward or backward as long as you have the will to act. It can be an old problem coming back, or repeating itself.
It could be eperiencing what you'll have in the future in a small burst, like a small success with a business that's going to explode with success soon.
Remember that it's just a taste. You can't fully live in the past or future without hurting yourself and others.

Sometimes it's literally magic, supernatural even. It's something you do not know about, a concept or process you know nothing about, something so foreign to you it may as well be arcane.
Like Bureaucracy
Not everything is meant to be known to you, you don't need to know literally everything.
Acceptance of shit beyond you is core to this card.

This is the thing that should have ended or changed. It may be beautiful, but it's still wrong. You could not face or let go of this thing, so now it waits for you to face it. You have to go to it to face it, it will not come for you.
This might be hard, you'll face difficulties, but you have to end it eventually.
The good news is you don't have to do so alone.

The candle implies ritual, not necessarily magical, but ritual in the form of daily lives. What is the first thing you do in the morning? At night? These are the rituals of our lives.
The candles ask you to recognize your rituals, how these affect you, your life, and your problems.

A demonic parade leading those who are roped up into it elsewhere. Maybe the underworld or faerie lands, but it is a final run wherever it goes.
A trail of sickness follows the hunt, see the warning signs. See the call of the void, but it's dark and ends poorly. Do not follow.
